sen.j: 秦熊（はだのくま、生没年不詳）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HADA no Kuma (year of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.
sen.cmt: 生没年不詳→year of birth and death unknownとしました (用語統一リストの指示より）
sen.e: HADA no Kuma (year of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.
HADA no Kuma (year of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は造。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Miyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 公→括弧内に姓の説明があるので、造についてはそのままローマ字表記のみとしました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Miyatsuko.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Miyatsuko.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）につき、倭京に集結中の敵軍に単騎のりこみ虚報を流した。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he was on the side of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and rode a horse alone to Wakyo (a city in Yamato), where the enemy troops were gathering, to give them false information.

In the Jinshin War in 672, he was on the side of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and rode a horse alone to Yamato-no-miyako (the capital), where the enemy troops were gathering, to spread false information among them.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。固有名詞読み間違い、「倭京」は他の固有名詞と同じように日本語として「やまとのみやこ」と読む方が良いです。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he was on the side of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and rode a horse alone to Yamato-no-miyako (the capital), where the enemy troops were gathering, to spread false information among them.

sen.j: 秦氏は渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: The Hata (Hada) clan was descended from immigrants to ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 秦氏：秦熊=はだのくま と訳しているので"Hata (Hada) clan" としました。
sen.e: The Hata (Hada) clan was descended from immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Hata (Hada) clan was descended from immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）6月下旬に大海人皇子が挙兵すると、大伴吹負はこれに従うことを決め、大和国で数十人の同志を集めた。
sen.e: When Prince Oama raised an army in late July of the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru [one of the Oriental Zodiac]) (672), OTOMO no Fukei decided to follow him and gathered dozens of comrades in Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 壬申の年→壬申という言葉を残し、the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru [one of the Oriental Zodiac])と訳しました（括弧内の説明は用語登録有り）
sen.e: When Prince Oama raised an army in late June (in old lunar calendar) of the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru [one of the Oriental Zodiac], year 672), OTOMO no Fukei decided to follow him and gathered dozens of comrades in Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 月を旧暦に直し、説明を加えます。
sen.e: When Prince Oama raised an army in late June (in old lunar calendar) of the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru [one of the Oriental Zodiac], year 672), OTOMO no Fukei decided to follow him and gathered dozens of comrades in Yamato Province.

sen.j: この中に秦熊もいたと考えられる。
sen.e: HADA no Kuma is thought to have been among them.
HADA no Kuma is thought to have been among them.
HADA no Kuma is thought to have been among them.

sen.j: しかし倭京に集結中の大友皇子側の軍勢は数千から万を越えたと推測され、吹負の人数で太刀打ちできるものではなかった。
sen.e: However, it is estimated that the number of the troops on the side of Prince Otomo, who were gathering in Wakyo, exceeded several thousands or ten thousands, and Fukei's troops was no match for them.

However, it is estimated that the number of the troops on the side of Prince Otomo, who were gathering in Yamato-no-miyako, exceeded several thousands or ten thousands, and Fukei's troops was no match for them.

However, it is estimated that the number of the troops on the side of Prince Otomo, who were gathering in Yamato-no-miyako, exceeded several thousands or ten thousands, and Fukei's troops was no match for them.

sen.j: その軍は留守司高坂王と近江からの使者穂積百足らが編成していた。
sen.e: The enemy's troops were organized by Takasaka no Okimi, who was Rusutsukasa (a guard of the city), and HOZUMI no Momotari, who was an envoy from Omi Province.
sen.cmt: その軍→"敵軍"と訳しました。
sen.e: The troops in Yamato-no-miyako were organized by Takasaka no Okimi who was Todomarimamoru-tsukasa (guard of the city) of Yamato, and by HOZUMI no Momotari who was an envoy from the Omi Imperial Court (supporting Prince Otomo).
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。「近江」は「近江朝廷」のことです。
sen.e: The troops in Yamato-no-miyako were organized by Takasaka no Okimi who was Todomarimamoru-tsukasa (guard of the city) of Yamato, and by HOZUMI no Momotari who was an envoy from the Omi Imperial Court (supporting Prince Otomo).

sen.j: 大伴吹負は、別の留守司坂上熊毛と相談し、一、二の漢直（倭漢氏の直）に下記のように言った。
sen.e: OTOMO no Fukei consulted with another Rusutsukasa, SAKANOUE no Kumake, and told some of Aya no Atai (Yamato no Ayauji no Atai [those who belonged to Yamato no Aya clan and held the kabane of Atai]) as follows:
sen.cmt: 漢直（倭漢氏の直）→Aya no Atai (Yamato no Ayauji no Atai [those who belonged to Yamato no Aya clan and held kabane of Atai]) と訳しました (定訳不明です）。この行に「下記のように」を追加して、「」外の文章を一文にしました。
sen.e: OTOMO no Fukei consulted with another Todomarimamoru-tsukasa, SAKANOUE no Kumage, and told a few Aya no Atai (the Yamatonoaya clan holding the title of Atai) his plan as follows.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「熊毛」は「kumage」、登録単語は間違いです。「倭漢氏の直」という言い方はとても変てこでこのオリジナル著者しか使わないと思われますが、原文をそのまま正しく訳しました。
sen.e: OTOMO no Fukei consulted with another Todomarimamoru-tsukasa, SAKANOUE no Kumage, and told a few Aya no Atai (the Yamatonoaya clan holding the title of Atai) his plan as follows.

sen.j: 「我は偽って高市皇子と名乗り、数十騎を率いて飛鳥寺の北路から陣営に臨む。」
sen.e: 'I will falsely introduce myself as Prince Takechi and approach the enemy camp with dozens of horse soldiers by the north route of the Asuka-dera Temple.'
sen.cmt: 「」内の文章を一文ごとに分けました
sen.e: 'I will falsely introduce myself as Prince Takechi and approach the enemy camp with dozens of horse soldiers by the north route of the Asuka-dera Temple.'
'I will falsely introduce myself as Prince Takechi and approach the enemy camp with dozens of horse soldiers by the north route of the Asuka-dera Temple.'

sen.j: 「そのときおまえたちは内応せよ」
sen.e: 'Then you will respond accordingly.'
sen.cmt: 「」内の文章を一文ごとに分けました
sen.e: Then you take actions from the inside the camp correspondently.'
Then you take actions from the inside the camp correspondently.'

sen.j: 高市皇子は大海人皇子の子で、このころ実際には美濃国の不破郡で軍を編成中であった。
sen.e: Prince Takechi was a child of Prince Oama, and he was actually organizing a troop in Fuwa County, Mino Province, at that time.
Prince Takechi was a child of Prince Oama, and in fact he was organizing a troop in Fuwa County of Mino Province at that time.
Prince Takechi was a child of Prince Oama, and in fact he was organizing a troop in Fuwa County of Mino Province at that time.

sen.j: 6月29日、吹負たちは百済の家（場所は諸説あるが不明）で武装して、南門から出た。
sen.e: On August 1, Fukei and his comrades armed themselves at a house in Kudara (the place is unknown, although there are various theories about it), and came out from the south gate.
sen.cmt: 百済：括弧内に場所が不明である旨の補足があるので、ローマ字表記だけにしました。
sen.e: On June 29 (in old lunar calendar), Fukei and his comrades armed themselves at a house of Kudara (the place is unknown, although there are various theories about it), and departed from the south gate.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: On June 29 (in old lunar calendar), Fukei and his comrades armed themselves at a house of Kudara (the place is unknown, although there are various theories about it), and departed from the south gate.

sen.j: まず秦熊が犢鼻（牛の鼻に似た形のふんどし）をつけて馬に乗り、飛鳥寺の西にあった敵陣に馳せつけて、下記のように言った。
sen.e: Firstly, HADA no Kuma wearing Tokubi/Tousagi (犢鼻) (fundoshi [loincloth] shaped like a cow's nose) rode his horse to the enemy lines in the west of the Asuka-dera Temple, and said as follows:
sen.cmt: 犢鼻→Tokubi/Tousagi［正しい読み方が不明です］(fundoshi [loincloth] shaped like a cow's nose) と説明を補足しました。この行に“下記のように”を追記し、「」外の文章を一文にしました。
sen.e: Firstly, HADA no Kuma, wearing only tokubi (tokubi-kon, a loincloth shaped like a cow's nose), ran his horse to the enemy's camp, the west of Asuka-dera Temple, and said as follows.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。用語を統一します。
sen.e: Firstly, HADA no Kuma, wearing only tokubi (tokubi-kon, a loincloth shaped like a cow's nose), ran his horse to the enemy's camp, the west of Asuka-dera Temple, and said as follows.

sen.j: 「高市皇子が不破から来た。」
sen.e: Prince Takechi has arrived from Fuwa County.'
sen.cmt: 「」内の文章を一文ごとに分けました
sen.e: Prince Takechi has arrived from Fuwa County.'
Prince Takechi has arrived from Fuwa County.'

sen.j: 「軍勢が多く従っている。」
sen.e: 'There were many troops following him.'
sen.cmt: 「」内の文章を一文ごとに分けました
sen.e: Many troops are following him.'
Many troops are following him.'

sen.j: 陣営の兵士は熊が叫ぶ声を聞いて逃げ散った。
sen.e: Soldiers in the enemy's camp heard Kuma shouting and ran away.
Soldiers in the enemy's camp heard Kuma shouting and ran away.
Soldiers in the enemy's camp heard Kuma shouting and ran away.

sen.j: ここで大伴吹負が数十騎を率いて乗り付けると、熊毛と諸々の直が呼応した。
sen.e: Then OTOMO no Fukei appeared on a horse with dozens of horse soldiers, and Kumake and those of Atai responded accordingly.
sen.cmt: 直→those of Atai と訳しました。
sen.e: Then OTOMO no Fukei appeared on a horse with dozens of horse soldiers, and Kumage and each Atai responded from the inside.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。
sen.e: Then OTOMO no Fukei appeared on a horse with dozens of horse soldiers, and Kumage and each Atai responded from the inside.

sen.j: 計略は完全な成功をおさめ、穂積百足は殺され、高坂王は大海人皇子方に従った。
sen.e: The plan succeeded completely, and HOZUMI no Momotari was killed and Takasaka no Okimi obeyed the Prince Oama's side.
The plan succeeded completely, and HOZUMI no Momotari was killed and Takasaka no Okimi followed Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: The plan succeeded completely, and HOZUMI no Momotari was killed and Takasaka no Okimi followed Prince Oama.

sen.j: 以上を伝える『日本書紀』はふんどしで馬に乗った理由を語らない。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which describes the above story, does not state the reason why HADA no Kuma rode his horse wearing fundoshi (loincloth).

sen.j: 秦熊について他に記録はない。
sen.e: There are no other records about HADA no Kuma.
